comments:
Running Junit tests with a comma in their name causes Eclipse to run tests but 
display register no 

Versions:
Known to have bug: 2.1-RC3a (WindowsXP, Linux), 2.1RC3b (WindowsXP)
Does not to have the bug: 2.1-RC2

The JUnit tests in question can be run outside of Eclipse with the Junit textui 
runner.

The SWT exception is not interesting - it just says that there was an 
exception in the runnable passed to asyncExec.

The real error is NumberFormatException from 
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.junit.ui.HierarchyRunView.newTreeEntry.

Redirecting to the JDT team.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 26754 ***
